children.subject: I think there is a bug in the CalCentral system with those requirements. Submit a case to CalCentral.

I was under the same impression (that even a high school American History class would cover American History and Institutions), and the old degree audit system indicated that I had completed these requirements, but now CalCentral indicates that I haven't.

Same here. I took a history class in community college, it does say I finish the American History, but not American Institutions. It even says I haven't fulfilled Entry Level Writing, which is impossible since I am also a transfer.

history.content: No, I am sure that you are fine. I have been under the same situation with you. I tried to send a ticket to calcentral tech support and they just checked off the American institution requirement for me. Just make sure that assist.org proves there is an articulation between your college and Berkeley. Hope it helps :D

No, I am sure that you are fine. I have been in the same situation with you. I tried to send a ticket to calcentral tech support and they just checked off the American institution requirement for me. Just make sure that assist.org proves there is an articulation between your college and Berkeley. Hope it helps :D

This question really needs to be directed to your college adviser. Although your classmates could be right, I would discourage you from depending on anonymous student sources for something this important.

I am a junior transfer and I have completed a history course in community college. I never took any Poli Sci classes and the recent update on CalCentral shows that I need to complete the American Institutions Requirement. However, I was previously under the impression that taking a history class would fulfill both my American History and Institutions reqs according to assist.org

So was assist wrong? Do I have to take a Poli Sci class?
history.subject: American Institutions Requirement
